data.title: Bill Perkins — NMA Coaching Program
data.text:
Bill Perkins

During the last 35 years Bill has worked in the animation and film industry on

over 42 films, TV shows, DVDs, short films, and video games. He began his film

career as a layout artist at Walt Disney Feature Animation on Oliver and Co. and

continued a string of hits Including Little Mermaid, Beauty and the Beast, layout

lead on Rescuers Down Under, and art director on Aladdin. He left Disney

during Fantasia 2000 while art directing the Pines of Rome in 1994.

Bill moved to Warner bros to as a visual development artist, and art directed

Space Jam. After the success of Space Jam Bill was asked to help launch the

design for Shrek at DreamWorks. He then moved to San Francisco to production

design Frankenstein for ILM. When the project cancelled Bill returned to

Moorpark and opened High Street Studio, an independent preproduction and

design studio for clients that included Walt Disney Feature Animation, DNA

Productions, Character Builders, and Disneytoon Studios. In 2005, he worked

with the 9 th Ray Studios on Outlander a live action project (Ascendant Films), The

Spiderwick Chronicles and Charlotte’s Web (Paramount). In 2007 Bill worked

with Spark unlimited, a video game company. By the end of the year, he rejoined

Walt Disney Feature Animation Studio and worked as visual development artist

on Bolt, Prep and Landing I and II, Tangled, Frozen, Zootopia and art directed A

Tick Tock Tale. In 2011 he began working with Disneytoon Studio and for the

next 6 years did artwork for WDI, and Walt Disney Pictures, and MPC. After

leaving Disneytoons he worked on Mary Poppins Returns, then Warner

bros./Netflix on Green Eggs and Ham. Bill is currently executive of Visual

Development at Marvel Studios and track leader for Entertainment Art at the Art

Center College of Design.
